string.name: article_detail
string.value: As terminal device forms become increasingly diversified, during the application design, you should ensure that a user interface (UI) can adapt to different screen sizes, screen orientations, and device types. In addition, the multi-device experience continuity needs to be maintained, the multi-device independent design needs to be improved, and the workload and maintenance costs of developers need to be reduced as much as possible. HarmonyOS provides a multi-device-oriented design guide, allowing designers to use a scientific method to minimize the design workload and ensure design consistency. In addition, HarmonyOS provides corresponding technical capabilities to help developers quickly design multi-device applications.
